body: It is probably specific to FreeBSD, I can not reproduce on Linux.

> It is probably specific to FreeBSD, I can not reproduce on Linux.

Yes, no this problem on both Linux and MacOS.
I get this too on FreeBSD 11.2.

rename.from: [FreeBSD] Filesystem Watcher Errors: error while traversing /path/to/exists/file_or_dir: no such file or directory
rename.to: Dangling symlink prevents filesystem watcher on FreeBSD

body: This might be kqueue specific, which is used on the BSD variants, and available but unused in favor of fswatcher on macos. We could add a test stage with `-tags kqueue` on macos to test with that backend for notify.
Hello. I'm having this issue on DragonFly BSD as well.

Hi, I am having the same issue on 

Freebsd 11.3-RELEASE-p5 with 
Syncthing v1.3.0 64bit.

**Fix possible?**
I also think it might be some shortcoming of kqueue. Maybe it has to be called with a special flag, or it depends on some specific kernel-patch? 
This page gives some hints (the test explanations in README):
[https://github.com/libinotify-kqueue/libinotify-kqueue](https://github.com/libinotify-kqueue/libinotify-kqueue)

**maybe-workaround?**
If it depends on the presence of a kernel/library-feature, maybe syncthing could check for that and give a better failure-message?  or it could try to just not watch the offending symlinks (and tell the user), so that theres *some* support for watching.

**do i need watching anyways?**
For the moment i turn off watching completely on this machine. Is there anything to keep in mind about that? It is just a fileserver used as a always-on hub for syncthing. "No" changes on the server are to be expected.
Hi. I'm bitten by this as well (FreeBSD 11.3). Is there any chance this will get fixed in the near future?

I don't think any of the maintainers runs BSD, so I don't think it's a high priority for us.
We're happy to accept pull requests fixing this.

I suspect a proper fix would needs to happen in the underlying libraries we use.

issue.title: build: Update notify (fixes #5360)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

milestone.title: v1.12.0
milestone.description: This release adds a new config REST API.

issue.body:
I added the commits of the following two PRs filed upstream to our fork. They contain a fix for the dangling symlink issue on BSDs (#5360) and add more meaningful info to a panic we see quite frequently in sentry. I'll keep trying to get this upstreamed.

https://github.com/rjeczalik/notify/pull/194
https://github.com/rjeczalik/notify/pull/193

issue.title: Dangling symlink prevents filesystem watcher on Solaris

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: New issues needed to be validated

issue.body:
Like Issue #5360, dangling symlinks are an issue with the FEN filesystem watcher on Solaris.

Syncthing 1.18.3, Solaris 11.4.

I added `notify.FileNoFollow` to `subEventMask`, the targets of symlinks should never be watched.
